node.title: Sunny, warm and dry: New Year's forecast as Kiwis set for best possible start to 2022
node.description: What more could you ask for?
node.content: ["It's set to be the best possible start to 2022 for New Zealand, with the first week of January looking likely to bring warm and dry warm weather.", "And New Year's Eve is expected to bring the perfect conditions for saying sayonara to 2021 for most Kiwis - it'll be mild and dry everywhere except the lower South Island.", "WeatherWatch says the upper North Island may still feel like it's 20C by the time the clock strikes midnight, with the cooler areas - such as Queenstown and Taupo - the ones at higher elevations.", "\"Showers form in Fiordland and turns to heavier rain later today and tonight. Rain spreads into South Westland. Stewart Island will likely see showers and a few spits are possible in Southland,\" the forecaster said.", "\"A couple of isolated afternoon showers/downpours are possible in the ranges of the upper South Island (Marlborough) and the eastern ranges of the North Island. Elsewhere is completely dry or mainly dry.\"", "While it's mainly dry, the wind may bring some annoyance for Kiwis wanting to ring in the new year.", "Sou'westers will blow through Auckland and possibly the Coromandel Peninsula's coastal areas - but it's \"nothing at all serious, more annoying factor for some campers\", WeatherWatch says.", "The forecaster says the worst winds will be through the Southern Alps, where some areas may be gusty from the westerly quarter - and that may increase as day turns to night.", "New Year's Day will be sunny, warm and calm as a high settles over the country - and the whole first week of January is looking drier than average for most of New Zealand.", "But the tropics could yet spring a surprise.", "\"The tropics are very energetic and we're monitoring a low pressure zone in the Coral Sea which may become a tropical storm,\" WeatherWatch says.", "\"It's not likely to directly impact New Zealand as a storm based on latest modelling - but it has a complicated journey due to the large high pressure zone over us now moving in today and this weekend.\""]
